comments.body:
for your consideration, should it be exposed as the class that someone can create? The API seems to be always an already created instance, so here one could expect abstract or interface to describe the contract:
https://github.com/JamesBarwell/rpi-gpio.js/blob/6dd19bf1adf8ba3ac48f13bdc1aa60f4d05341ee/rpi-gpio.js#L507
I'm just following what the javascript does. The class is not exported by the javascript so the class won't be available to instantiate.

the api describes this as no args one:
https://github.com/JamesBarwell/rpi-gpio.js#destroy
but the source as optional:
https://github.com/JamesBarwell/rpi-gpio.js/blob/master/rpi-gpio.js#L310
```suggestion
    destroy(cb?: ErrorCallback): void;
```
In this case the source is incorrect. If you do pass a callback you get errors. I will correct the docs comment
